intro: Cincinalis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cincinalis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
